Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph C
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego once a month on Business and I have stayed at most Hotels in the area but the level of service cleanliness of the rooms and the Embassy Suites San Diego staff keeps me comingf back every month I don't book my stays anywhere else. Thanks Embassy crew for your commitment to Excellence and quality stay Joseph Miami Beach

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected from Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Scout1960
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites hotel is closer to the USS Midway exhibit than to the Gaslight District, which means some suites have bay views. The hotel is well maintained, the service is up to the usual standards of the chain, and the breakfast was good, as always. There is remodeling going on, but we weren't inconvenienced by it. Valet parking is your only option, and it's pricey at $29 a night, but that is less than what I found at other downtown hotels. The Convention Center is within walking distance, but you'll need a car or be willing to take public transportation or a cab to get just about anywhere else within the downtown district.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but lots of rough edges”
Reviews.Author: uttrekr
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family the week of March 11 and was looking forward to it initially. The property has a great location right on the bay overlooking the Midway and the staff was really good with information and even a call from the concierge before we arrived. Once there though it was another matter. The bathroom sink had a faucet issue and housekeeping didn't follow up to mop the floor afterward. Called the front desk, was told they would send someone up in 10, an hour later gave up and threw towels down to bathe the kid and called to cancel - 20 min later housekeeping shows up as I'm putting the kid to bed. Next up - hot water. It frequently went cold when taking a shower at night. Got a letter claiming they were replacing the boiler but the next day my wife got 'frosted' 3 times during her shower. Even the famous breakfast was messedup - every other day got a runny omlet. Finally please be warned they require a $29/day valet and there is no airport shuttle service despite close proximity to the airport. All that said though they do have a good location and the Embassy chain as a whole is usually much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: vlcowles
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Embassy Suites on numerous occassions. We are from the San Diego area but when we have a function of any kind downtown we like to stay at this property. The hotel has recently refurbished the furniture and t.v.'s in the room. The breakfast is standard for Embassy Suites, not the best but not the worst I have experienced. The location is awesome. Very close to Sea Port Village and only a few blocks from the Gas Lamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over for Hawaii Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Rene S
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with a travel guide and group of thirty enroute to a cruise on 2/24/12. Our group arrived late morning due to time changes from the midwest and the manager allowed us to occupy 16 rooms before check in time. This was so appreciated. My husband and I were taking the trip to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. Our guide must have previously shared this with the hotel and we had a lovely 12th floor suite with a beautiful balcony view of the Bay. On our table from Anthony Longa, the senior catering manager, were two traveling coffee mugs and two certificates for Starbucks. The location was great to view and shop at the Seaport Village and have dinner nearby. The breakfast at the Suites was great! Thanks for making our trip even better.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Gordon T
Reviews.Content: Attended a three day conference that was held on the property. Conference room was centrally located and serviced multiple times throughout the day. (Water/Soda/Bagels/Cookies etc.) Breakaway rooms were available for any splinter group meeting requirements. Hotel room itself was very comfortable with above average quality linens/towels/bath products. Breakfast and Manager's receptions just serve as the icing on the cake. Really no reason to stay at any other venue when Emabassy is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel with Free Appetizers, Cocktails!”
Reviews.Author: TravelReviews4You
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites never ceases to please me with their manager's reception, large two room suites, multiple TVs and Crabtree and Evelyn bath/body products, this hotel offers a bit more than that! The lobby area is quite lovely with all rooms overlooking the area. The lobby included tons of plants and really does a great job of bringing the outside indoors. This is also an ideal location for either a business or personal trip and most rooms offer views of the bay. Comfy bed, though the bed spread was a bit itchy. The only downfall is if you are a light sleeper, the train is right here and the horn may keep you up.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Trip”
Reviews.Author: Scott C
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, enjoyed manager's reception and breakfast for reasonable price. Problem with TV was fixed in minutes! We stayed only one night, wish it could have been longer. Close to most everything in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for walking the bay”
Reviews.Author: dugan_charles
Reviews.Content: I checked into the San Diego Bay Embassy Suites for a 2 day get-away and found it perfect for my needs. I could walk 2 blocks to Sea Port Village and catch the Seal bus and water transport, walk 3 blocks to the convention center and catch a burger at the Kansas City Barbeque restaurant (scene of Tom Cruise's "Top Gun" movie), walk another 3 blocks to the Midway Aircraft Carrier Museum. There was so much to do within walking distance that I didn't have to spend money to get around. Then there was the free "happy hour" at the hotel and the free breakfast. It was a wonderful 2 day get-away with a great room-suite with a view of the San Diego skyline. I even had my hair done in the beauty salon. The concierge was most helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “A convention hotel....”
Reviews.Author: flyover11
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and fresh, service was just fine. Location was close to the harbor and shopping. Not a bad stay. But the smell of breakfast wafting into your room at 5:30 a.m. is just too much. The Concierge was very helpful. We booked a Gray Line City Tour through the hotel and made dinner reservations. Not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Train kept a rollin all night long”
Reviews.Author: Jetlager
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites has a promising location and price near the marina and near the Manchester Grand Hyatt. However, it also is atrium style meaning that the entire inside is open which can be very loud. Due to the room configuration, which is sitting room by entrance, bedroom in back, one would think that the bedroom would be quiet. But no! Just as I was falling asleep, a train came cruising by (horns on full blast). This happened two or three more times during the night. I've changed my flight out to a 6:00 a.m. flight because I won't be sleeping anyway. Not sure if it's better on another side of the hotel. Plus, I think I have food poisoning from the eggs in the breakfast buffet (which at least was free).

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel with excellent guest services”
Reviews.Author: Allan L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed for 2 nights in January 2012. Beautiful lobby and decor, rooms were very nice, spacious and clean. Very good breakfast buffet and afternoon bar and snacks. One of the best locations in San Diego, nearby the water and attractions. The staff and management were top notch - when we were there, they had boiler troubles and there wasn't enough hot water in the mornings. At checkout, they asked how things were and when we mentioned the water problem, which they knew about, they offered each party a complimentary stay. The general manager, Will Hobbs, contacted me after I completed an online survey, and personally followed up to be sure we received the certificates. Outstanding follow-up service to top off a great stay. We highly recommend the Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this facility. Walking distance to most area's in the Gas Lamp district, convention center and light rail transportation. The rooms were big, comfortable and clean. The morning breakfast was terrific and the evening hosted happy hour a nice treat. These guys do it right. The kids will love the elevator ride. Give them a try, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: To_Far_From_Paradise
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last week in February. Booked the hotel on the hilton mvp site and got a great deal compared to neighbouring hotels. Pros. The hotel is about 15 mins. walk from the convention centre and Gastown so is well located. The cook-to-order breakfast is convenient and has lots of choices. The omelettes were great! The Manager's Reception every night is a great way to unwind with a beverage. All the staff was very professional and friendly. The rooms are huge - two beds and a separate living area with fold-out sofa, dinner table, microwave and refrigerator. This would be a great place for a family of four or five. Cons. Other than the freshly made omelettes, most of the "hot" buffet food was actually cold. This happened on several days. The rooms are a bit dated but it looks like they are being renovated, so it might be a good idea to ask for a newly renovated room. Despite my minor quibbles this is a great deal along the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blkloni
Reviews.Content: Staying here was a last minute choice and we will be back. Rooms are so clean and spacious. Everyone is so friendly and we were accommodated at a decent rate with no problem. Woke up to the smell of breakfast....full hot breakfast at that, not continental and a starbucks outside the lobby. We were definitely comfortable here. Family friendly place in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific happy hour”
Reviews.Author: iataan
Reviews.Content: This ES is very nicely located, across from the Seaport Village. It has a very nice view of the Bay and the ships passing by. As always, the breakfast was very good with a nice variety of fare. We've stayed in many ES and this one by far had the best Happy Hour. The snacks were healthy and filling--the mixed drinks, beer and wine very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Spot”
Reviews.Author: Edwin S
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay and this place is awesome. The indoor pool, Jacuzzi and weight are the best. The location is within walking distance to the Gas Light District.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: dgnancy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to stay in Downtown San Diego. We were across the street from Seaport Village, within walking distance to Horton Plaza, the Gaslamp District, cruise ship terminals (the whale watching was wonderful!) and the sightseeing trolley. As always, the room was extremely clean, the hotel personnel were friendly and helpful, and the made-to-order breakfast and manager's reception at night were great. We had a huge Bayside suite with a baIcony and were able to watch the ships coming and going all day. I will definitely stay here again and will recommend it to everyone I know who is planning a trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: klaggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first night up the street at the Holiday Inn - that was a disaster as previously reviewed. This hotel is just up the street and close to the bay. You can easily walk downtown to the Gas Lamp restaurants or the the big shopping mall - 5 short city blocks away, or you can walk to the Midway museum and the harbour cruises in 5 minutes. You have to valet park your vehicle - which is ok since you walk most places and can get your vehicle quite quickly if you need it. The hotel has a nice free breakfast in the morning and a happy hour with free drinks in the evening. My only complaint is that it does not free WIFI internet - although if you ask they will give you a complimentary few free hours or you can use one of the 3 free terminals in the lobby ( although they can all be occupied at certain times). For the money this as the best hotel on the San Diego waterfront IMO.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at another Embassy Suites again.”
Reviews.Author: HighlandMommy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for one night on business. It was the worst experiences I have had at a hotel at any price level. I travel frequently all over the world for business. This time I was hosting a guest from out of the country and we chose to stay downtown San Diego for the experience for him, but I was very embarrassed by this hotel. This hotel is charging a premium rate and trying to put a premium window dressing on the experience but is completely incapable of executing the fundamentals. Here are the specifics: -- Valet parking is the only option for parking and it is $30. Everything in this area of town is expensive, but still for $30 you would expect good service. It is horrible. It took over 15 minutes to get the car. Furthermore all the cars arriving were stacked up and no one could get in because they were so slow to park them. -- Front desk staff is very rude and slow. We inquired about early check-in and without even checking the reception staff just said nothing was available. Ok fine, but this also meant we could not utilize the business center because although it is next to the front desk it requires a key to enter and we were not allowed to use it until we could be assigned a room. -- WiFi fee is $13/day and there is no free option in the lobby. -- The elevators are slow and it is a long wait for this busy hotel. I finally was checked in and I went to my room on 9th floor only to find my keys would not work. I made my way back to the lobby, waited in line again, they re-scanned my keys with NO apology, I went back up to my room, again the keys did not work. I went back down waited in line again -- 40 minutes wasted. This time they discover OOPS! they had given me the wrong room. They get this straightened out, hand me a key and I head to my room. NO apology. -- The room was clean. However, they are changing from old tube tvs to flat screens and the armoire in my room was half dismantled with video game controllers hanging out like a college dorm. -- Breakfast. Somehow they managed to burn our custom cooked omelettes. The food at the buffet was terrible...soggy potatoes, rubbery French toast and the toaster barely worked. -- While we were eating breakfast a maintenance worker rolled a cart through the middle of where everyone was eating. On top of the cart was a kitchen floormat. We saw him go through the kitchen and came right back with what appeared to be the same cart now with clean dishes were the mat was and go put them out at the buffet. -- The hotel was very busy and I saw a lot of employees standing around doing a whole lot of nothing while guests were waiting for help. I will spend my money elsewhere the next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: jmrws1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for business travelers or if you are in town for the weekend. Rooms are great and most have good views of the city or bay. Managers reception gets very busy so i advise showing up early If i am going to San Diego, then i am staying there and no where else Good Perks for Hilton Honors members

Reviews.Title: “Holiday parade”
Reviews.Author: mso4gtt
Reviews.Content: I love the suite we had, only wish they would have offer to upgrade like our other hotel did. For being as busy as it was service was good. Love the location, valet little expensive, and only pool to small and crowed. Overall love the hotel I would stay there again only not durning holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and hotel for a couple's weekend”
Reviews.Author: jland0001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends this past weekend. The rooms had great views of the bay. Ours was a corner room with a large living room. The bed was really comfortable. The staff was pleasant. The rate was really low considering that the hotel has a nice happy hour and free breakfast. The breakfast included made to order omelettes, fresh fruit and all the extras. The three negatives were: (1) car valet service was really slow, (2) the windows really needed to be cleaned and (3) $29 per night for valet parking seemed a bit stiff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a good, central location for lots of activities in San Diego. One great plus is the reasonable price considering its location to Gaslamp and other downtown amenities. It is a bit tricky getting into the hotel the first time (I find San Diego a bit hard to nagivate) but after that it is cake. It is adjacent to walking areas along the water. I used the health club and found that very adequate and clean; they stock plenty of extra towels. The pool is adequate for modest-sized laps and also for families. The breakfast is very good and a very nice plus; it is hot. They make omelets to order and have plenty of fresh fruit plus all the other usual stuff. Only downside is proximity to airport, therefore you can hear airplanes if you keep your windows open (nice thing, you can keep your windows open! - I was on 11 of 12 floor) though the noise subsided after about 10. I ate light supper in their small sports bar / restaurant (salad & wine) - food passable, quick service. I would definately stay here again. Very safe area, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Chris275
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for a corporate meeting - great location, walking distance to Seaport Village, Gaslamp district, Horton Plaza, Midway aircraft carrier, my gym. Weather was unseasonably warm, 72 degrees. Room featured microwave oven, mini fridge, good countertop space for toiletries. Breakfast was great; compliments to the breakfast cook who was quick and very pleasant. Manager's reception featured crudites, chips, popcorn, beverages. Folks lined up at the bar for free drinks. Only gripes: parking$29/day valet only - waited over 20 minutes and was told valet was given wrong key; found room door was left ajar one afternoon. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable”
Reviews.Author: Chicagodocjerry
Reviews.Content: This is the typical Embassy Suites. Appreciated the very large suite and the view of the harbor from the 12th floor suite was amazing. Breakfast was fine, although I thought the staff could have been friendlier; they were in robot mode in the mornings, it seemed. The only thing I don't like about Embassy Suites is the fact that in the morning your room begins to smell like the bacon cooking on the ground floor as early as 5:00 A.M., but that's part of the territory with Embassy Suites. Room was sparkling clean and the housekeeping staff did a great job. The location is fantastic and the valet service and the valet employees were super-friendly and quite helpful with directions. This was my second visit to this hotel and I would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Diego frequently on business and LOVE this hotel. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is centrally located across from Seaport Village on the trolley line and walking distance to the Gaslamp distict. The hotel is clean and friiendly to both business and recration travelers. Breakfast and the nightly reception are great, this is the first hotel I look for availability when I travel to the area!

Reviews.Title: “not a better place in san diego”
Reviews.Author: PETE90
Reviews.Content: Dollar for dollar THIS is the place. The best free breakfast in town. Two blocks from everything. The trolly to everyplace else is behind the hotel. The view? The harbor is across the street-- Ships come in and out all day--it's '''almost''in a movie set. The airport is 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: chivato09
Reviews.Content: Ok, so i have a dog....do you know how rare it is to find a hotel of this quality that allows you to bring your beloved pet???...take my word for it, its rare. My husband and i had a beautiful room with a view of the harbor at Christmas time and it was spectacular. Not to mention the convenience to downtown san diego, harbor sights and great restaurants. I dont know why others have complained about the staff as I found them to be cheerful, friendly and accomodating; particularly the front desk staff...and i must tell you, they were like this even though this is one of the busiest hotels ive ever been to. Yeah, ill have to admit the parking fees are pretty annoying...but how many hotels of this caliber dont have them in a big city??? I thought the perks outweighed the fees: free breakfast and free happy hour drinks and snacks. Very generous! I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Embassy Suites for a business meeting in the hotel for 2 nights. The hotel has large rooms and they were very clean. Breakfast is included and is amazing. There is a chef that will make you eggs or omelets. They also have everything else from french toast, pancakes, fruit, juice, toaster ovens etc. They have a bar in the hotel that serves very good food that is reasonable. There are also tv's in the bar so I was able to catch the game before I had to leave to the airport. The hotel is located just across the street from San Diego Bay. The Midway Aircraft Carrier was an easy walk (almost right across the street) and it is a great inexpensive tour (about $18.00). There are also bay cruises and whale watching trips that are very reasonably priced. The Seaport Village is also a very short walk from the hotel and it has many stores and restaurants that are very interesting. We walked to Little Italy for dinner one night and it was an easy walk but quite a bit longer (about 12 blocks). Dinner there was amazing and the atmosphere is very cool. The hotel staff I found to be very friendly and they were very responsive to a couple of requests that I had. Our group had arranged an airport shuttle from the hotel as part of the trip but I did not arrive at the airport until after 11:00pm and the shuttle was no longer picking up passengers. They informed me that I would need to take a taxi (less than $10.00). The also refunded my taxi fare when I checked in, tip and everything. I will certainly stay at this hotel again the next time I am in San Diego. They are reasonably priced, the location is fantastic and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: williamtwo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ES DWTN SD from Dec 25th - Dec 29th, 2011 with my wife and 2.5 year old son. We used ES SD a base to visit Balboa Park, Legoland and SD Zoo which worked out great from that aspect. Great location and room size with fridge and microwave included. Positives - friendly checkin, no line for parking at 5pm on Xmas night. Corner king room with a bay view as booked was great. We booked a Getaway Rate which included free parking, 15% off room service charges and on-demand movie each night. Large bathroom with bathtub (plus when traveling with toddler kiddo). NOTE: All parking is valet and off-site. Valet staff are friendly and very professional. We always felt very safe walking anytime day or night. Starbucks is connected to the hotel.The days we did eat breakfast in the hotel, it was good, hot and great selection. Managers happy hour was good and never overly crowded; na drinks, beer - Michelob Amber Bock and Rolling Rock plus chips, trail mix and veggies for snacks. Negatives - Hotel is in the middle of a re-model or room upgrades. Free full breakfast was a nightmare wait as the hotel was maxed at capacity with number of people per room and rooms taken, due to 2 conferences and the TX/Cal college bowl game that week. Line was wrapped throughout the atrium each morning for breakfast unless you went 7am. This also lead to ridiculous waits for the elevators - there are 4 but it didnt help as one was unavailable due to installation of new flat screens being transported for 2 days we were there. We ended up at the Hyatt one morning and at Busters in Seaport Village (good place) a 2nd morning for breakfast due to craziness. Valet parking was crazy busy since everyone has to valet it can make for long waits between post-breakfast at 930am - Noon checkout time. Negatives -Room service - limited menu due to remodel in progress. Basically, you get your room service food from the restaurant/bar downstairs. Many times the restaurant is so packed at night, they would not answer the phone so I went down and place my orders in person to-go. Overheard the bartender and wait staff talking that they do not answer the phone the last 30 minutes before room service closes. Great location to everything - USS Midway, Seaport Village, Bay dinner cruises and Star of India. TIPS - go across the street to the Grand Hyatt and have a drink or catch the view at the Top of the Hyatt Bar. Top of The Fish Market (upstairs fine dining) or downstairs Fish Market are good places for dinner but its crazy busy downstairs. Visit, but do not eat at Kansas City BBQ place where Top Gun movie was filmed. Would I stay here again? Yes, based on location and room size, if the price were right, didnâ€™t care about the free breakfast and not maxed at capacity.

Reviews.Title: “OK alternative, but I expected more”
Reviews.Author: azg12
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Embassy Suites Hotel La Quinta right before travelling to San Diego, I was expecting at least the same standard from a hotel belonging to the same chain located in the second largest city in California, but unfortunately that was not the case. While the location of the hotel is unbeatable and we had a fantastic view of San Diego Bay from our room, the hotel is in need of some renewal: furniture in our room was quite old, with clear marks of heavy use. One of the curtains was falling apart and it had been fixed with tape. On the positive side, the old TV that was still in place during our first night at the hotel was replaced the next day with a new LCD widescreen TV - so it looks like renovation is taking place, at least to a certain extent. As many reviewers have metioned, valet parking is ridiculously expensive - I certainly missed the free parking at La Quinta, and the opportunity of parking the car myself. Overall, not a bad option when staying in San Diego: great location, decent room size, free breakfast, but certainly not a premium choice.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Stars for Embassy”
Reviews.Author: mmmduffser
Reviews.Content: I have always loved staying at Embassy and this one is no disappointment. The breakfast is amazing...full course and very well prepared. The cocktail happy hour is always a fun treat. I took my folks to this hotel over Christmas and they had such a great time. They had never experienced an open aviary atmosphere with complimentary cocktails and they were really happy I picked this place... Embassy rarely disappoints and this one truly upholds their image. I am heading to KC in a few weeks and booked another one...we shall see how it compares. Just a quick note though...parking is in the mid-twenties per night so be prepared for this but most all of the downtown hotels are like this...so no big problem...just an fyi.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Chippie1308
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in 2 rooms in late November - it is well located, the rooms were comfortable and spacious, breakfast was enjoyable, staff were pleasant and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again Only problem was some of the electrical outlets were in need of maintenance (note to hotel management)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ganta07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located walking distance to The Gaslamp District, Seaport Village and Harbor Drive. There is a restaurant in the hotel that offers the usual fare of burgers and bar food. The fish tacos were excellent. Like most Embassy Suites the hotel offers a very nice free breakfast. I stayed here during Christmas and the lines were pretty long for breakfast. Other than that this is a great place to stay and explore San Diego. Only about a 15 minute cab ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pre-Christmas Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: Zonie083
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take a quick vacation before the Christmas holiday and this hit the spot. The hotel suited our needs: big two rooms suite so no one had to share a bed (we have teenagers and a a toddler) and right on the edge of downtown and the SD bay activities. Valet is quick and accomodating (if you have a car there's really no other option) and the full and free breakfast and evening manager's reception were popular for all. The staff was friendly and helpful... but don't be in an extreme hurry to get something done. Although somewhat dated, the room was clean and the beds were comfortable - even the sleeper. A free crib and refrrigerator made things easier as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: Jill L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was listed in a book "The Unofficial Guide to California with Kids". We wanted a good location for our 6 year old son's first trip to San Diego. We took the Amtrak from LA to San Diego. The train station was 2 blocks away from the hotel, it was a short walk. We didn't rent a car nor did we need one. The room was spacious. The free breakfast and snack time was perfect for our family. The indoor pool was the highlight for our son. When we needed hotel staff, they were responsive and friendly. I would recommend this hotel for families!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location... staff could use a little help”
Reviews.Author: fig_dawg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights while my wife had a business meeting in town. Our room was very nice and our check in was quick. However, we got a parking charge when we didn't have a car. When we asked to have it removed I got a bunch of drama from the staff. They said they have to check with a valet and, essentially, called me a liar. So it's a great location at a fair price but not the customer service I've grown to expect from hilton.

Reviews.Title: “That's All?”
Reviews.Author: stylnz8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and for the price it was great. I had a corner room (slightly bigger) overlooking the harbor. A hot breakfast every morning and happy hour every night inuded in the price. Your near the convention center, the gas lamp district where you will find a plethora of great food and shopping within walking distance as we as being close to harbor village, walking/bike paths and the Middway. The rooms are clean and best of all the windows open to catch a nice sea breeze. I love hotels where the windows open, some times hotel rooms can be stuffy when you spend enough time in them. The bed, pillows and linens were more very comfortable. I had a nice firm pillow with a nice scruntchy one to smoosh however I wanted. We also had a great view of the parade of lights from our room, what a nice end to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: lprev0st_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Embassy Suites in downtown San Diego. Great location, can walk everywhere and we did. It also offers the best happy hour and a half I've attended-they make great rum punches. Service is excellent and a hot breakfast is included in your stay! The rooms are clean but the decor is a little dated!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location in town”
Reviews.Author: eggegm
Reviews.Content: Rooms and Breakfast great as usual for Embassy. I would have liked better selections for the complimentary drinks for the happy hour. Location on Pacific makes the drive very easy to get around. The walk to the Gas Lamb is through a residential neighborhood and a park where many people walk their dogs. The front desk was very friendly as was the morning cook. The Valet early morning (7ish) averaged 5 to 10 minutes which was good. Some train noise but really not bad.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: JesseLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Staff was pleasant, modest suite was clean if bland, the entryway, lobby, and relaxing area (as mentioned by others) was nice with its sky high openness, the sounds of running water, etc. However - that nice bay view from our window was marred by tents housing the homeless lined up on the sidewalk across the street. $29 per night parking seemed a ridiculous expense, regardless of the alleged "going rate" -- and they lost my house keys to boot. The free breakfast made to order was less than impressive. We quit eating there after one day. Regardless of this hotel being "so close" to everything - it feels isolated. We walked to Seaport and the Gaslight District but it was a hike to the latter. It's surrounded by other hotels, an office supply store, and only offers one small limited deli around the corner. (Though coffee enthusiasts will love the Starbucks that's on premises.) The in-hotel restaurant offered is limited as well, as is room service. This is not a hotel I would recommend for any reason. I'm giving it a 2 star (poor) rating instead of a 3 (average) simply because I don't believe it delivers what it offers such as a view. Did I mention there's a broad multi-laned street and a huge parking lot filled with cars between the hotel and that "bay" view? Oh and the beds were miserably uncomfortable. And the movies were $20.00 each to rent!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: captrue
Reviews.Content: Since I had to stay at a conference hotel while I was in San Diego, I went with the Embassy Suites. It is a very nice property and located near Seaport Village, the Midway, the convention Center and many other attractions. The Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was large and clean with nice view of the bay. Breakfast and happy hour are free and while crowded at times offers a great selection. Meals are expensive in SD and so a free breakfast was appreciated. Overall a delightful experience. Just a word of warning, parking is a bit pricey so remember to budget that into your expenses.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: pondguyOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, clean, good business center. Breakfast & happy hour were good, not great, but they are free. Close enough to walk to the convention center and to the gas light district, but still a 15-20 minute walk. Heard the trains and noise from the hotel during the day and early evening, but didn't bother my sleep at all. Minor problem with the shower ceiling, but a clean room and comfortable bed. Front desk was prompt and courteous. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great breakfast and happy hour included”
Reviews.Author: hppytrvler
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in lovely San Diego. Walked to the local harbor and Navy Carrier during our visit witch was a hit with our teens. Indoor pool was warm but clorine was strong. Breakfast and happy hour were great. Kids enjoyed the stay and the rooms were clean and divided into a living area with pull out bed and separate sleeping room. Only downside was a small homeless population staying in the empty government lot accross the street but they did not bother anyone and we could nt see them from our room. I will definintely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal for conference-goers but nothing wrong with the stay”
Reviews.Author: travelerdiver
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying there is nothing wrong with this hotel. The staff is friendly, the rooms are HUGE and clean, the beds and pillows are comfortable, etc. The food in the evening is meh, okay, but the drinks are nice. The omelets are the best things for breakfast, the pre-cooked food seems to have sat for several hours. The hotel is just a BIT too far from the conference center for my liking...I really like to be able to stop up to my room over a 40 minute break to drop things off, change shoes, etc., and it's too far for that. It's also just a bit too far from the "action" of San Diego, in my opinion. It is close to the USS Midway and Seaport Village. And the hot tub was nice and hot.

Reviews.Title: “always amazing”
Reviews.Author: AnaArz
Reviews.Content: We've been staying in this hotel at least once a year since 2011. It's always a pleasant stay, hustle fee with amazingly clean rooms, great food and fantastic staff. Now even your dog is welcome there. thank you Hilton for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Items stolen from the room”
Reviews.Author: ss p
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the conference. A lap top, a camera and chargers were stolen from my room while I was gone out for dinner (for 2 hours). I was told nothing can be done as those items were not stored in the hotel safe while I was gone. I lost all my personal information, work saved in computer and memories saved in the camera in addition to the monitary loss of the Computer and camera. Should have known better by informing the police. Never in this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms and a great view”
Reviews.Author: HMByrd
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very helpful: the valets were quick and efficient, the room was always thoroughly cleaned each day, the wait staff were attentive and helpful, and the front desk was very helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and the view of the bay was outstanding. I traveled with my husband and 2-yr-old son and we had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Vikingrrl
Reviews.Content: Large clean rooms, convenient location, helpful staff. Free breakfast 7-9 am, happy hour 5-7 pm with complimentary drinks and nibblies in a setting of Koi pools. A nice swimming pool and Starbucks and 3 complimentary computers with printer available in the lobby to quickly check email and book reservations. Do guard your room key as there was a robbery while we were there due to misplaced key.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to everything you want to see”
Reviews.Author: patdmurphy
Reviews.Content: If you want the location where you can walk to everything and a reasonable price this is the place. It is slightly dated but clean and spacious. There were many families the weekend we were there but the rooms were very quiet. The breakfast was great and the managers reception everynight had a free full bar and light snacks. The rooms overlooked the city or the bay, however ours had a balcony which overlooked both. It was beautiful. My suggestion would be to get a room as high up as you can as the trolly and train station are close so lower rooms may be a little noisy, but that sound is just San Diego. We were able to easily walk at night to the Gas Lamp area and during the day to the Midway and shopping. There is a beautiful running/walking path across the street along the bay front which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rit101201
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel a lot. Very clean and very spacious room. Location is great, walking distance to many cool places, Seaport Village, Gaslamp distric. The free breakfast was excellent. The service was great. The valet parking was fast, didn't wait very long. We will stay again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilleysummer
Reviews.Content: We, and 2 other couples, stayed here 2 nights as part of a cruise and stay, so expected a mediocre hotel but not so....it was fabulous and one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in! We had just come off a cruise ship, and all of us were able to check into our rooms by late morning. The rooms were clean, well equipped and huge! Complimentary breakfast was one of the best in a beautiful atmosphere. After a day of sightseeing, the complimentary managers reception was great, not to mention the $$ it saved us. You could order most any drink, and the snacks changed each day. Cindy at the concierge was funny, friendly and knowledgeable. She arranged some great transportation and her restaurant recommendation was right on. We used the coin laundry, the convenience store, and Starbucks attached. Lobby has glassed off room with 3 computers that are complimentary for guests which was very convenient. Location is great - right across the street from Seaport Villlage and walking distance to many things. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Value”
Reviews.Author: M C M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the waterfront of San Diego, but it is only a short walk to downtown areas for meals, shopping, the Gaslamp district, etc. The staff is friendly and there are numerous amenities such as free breakfast, a pool, gym, free safe deposit box, and free happy hour. We got in with a special deal of $139 a night, though we had to pay for valet parking, it was cheaper than staying at some of the other downtown hotels. Getting in and out of the hotel was easy - good valet staff! We had a good stay and would go back when they have specials! Trip date: October 4 - 6, 2011

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and equipment not working in gym or in room”
Reviews.Author: willenkm
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member and this hotel lacks the luster of other Embassy's that I have stayed in. The microwave in our room did not work and we left a message in the room on the counter for the housekeeping staff and it was never replaced. Most of the gym equipment either didn't work properly or didn't work at all. The staff wasn't helpful and the concierge didn't know things we asked about the city. I live in Hilton Hotels and spent points to stay at this place and I wouldn't go back if it was FREE. I left some clothing in the room accidently upon check out and they claimed it was never found! I am rethinking my choice of hotel chains as nobody from the service department ever called me back after I complained to corporate. Stay elsewhere, you will be thankful.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel! Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this Embassy was less then favorable!!! On the last night of our stay we went out to dinner and left our laptop out in the hotel room. We were out for only a few hours, and upon our return, we're shocked to find that the laptop and charger were both missing from the room. We conducted an extensive search through the room with no success. The laptop was GONE!!! We proceeded by calling the front desk, to make them aware of what had happened and to have security check out who might have been able to come in during the time we were absent. According to the reading of the key entry, NO TRACE of entry was detected between the hours we were out! (Inside job?!) We asked if there might be cameras to see who could have come in during those hours, but SURPRISE only lobby cameras in this hotel! Both management and security were not even the least concerned with our problem, and acted as if we were lying about the entire thing. No apologies nor compensation was offered. We were told that the hotel's insurance would contact us, and that there was nothing they could do more for us. This was exactly one week ago! Today in the mail, we received a letter stating that the hotel was not responsible for this theft! DO NOT EVER LEAVE ANYTHING VALUABLE IN YOUR HOTEL ROOM! TAKE IT WITH YOU! IT WILL BE STOLEN AT EMBASSY SUITES AND THEY WILL NOT CARE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money & a great location too.”
Reviews.Author: mosmum
Reviews.Content: We chose Embassy Suites due to it's great location which is close enough to downtown but not right in the middle of it. It's also very close to Seaport Village which is a great place for both day and night. We arrived early as we had just got off a cruise ship but were given the keys to our room right away. The girl on the front desk was very helpful and friendly as was the concierge. We had paid extra to have a bay view room which we just about got if you craned your neck hard enough! That said the suite was a great size, especially after a cruise! Clean and tidy. Noise was not an issue. My only criticism would be that we wanted either a late check out or a room to get changed in for our night flight back to the UK. This was going to cost $99 which I thought was a bit steep. I think Embassy provide excellent value for money, the breakfast and managers reception saving you $$$. We had a great stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Virtual_Explorer_100
Reviews.Content: We chose Embassy Suites Downtown due to it's close proximity to Seaport Village. We were greeted by a very friendly front desk person who told us our room was ready. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we reserved a bay view room with a balcony. The bay view with a balcony was awesome. We could see San Diego Bay from Seaport Village to past the USS Midway (Aircraft Carrier). One night I saw flashes of light and went out on the balcony. The Midway was shooting fireworks off its bow and my family (wife and children 8 & 6) were treated to an unexpected fireworks show. The room had two queen beds, a couch and a desk. The Embassy Suites has a great breakfast. Two lines, one for mostly do it yourself stuff, and another line for made to order food service. The breakfast was very good. At night there is a managers greeting (read free happy hour). Seaport Village is across the street. Noise was not an issue on the bay side. We had a great stay and I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Far Below Expectations, Based on Price & Past Experience”
Reviews.Author: mishabisha
Reviews.Content: I love the Ebassy Suites in La Jolla and have had fantastic experiences there, so my expectations were high for this location. I live in San Diego, but often take "staycations" at local hotels. Upon valet parking the car (it's $29 and there are no other options at the hotel), my significant other and I informed the attendant that it was imperative no one roll down the driver side window, as it was broken. We were assured it would not happen. We arrived at 4 pm (check-in time) and were informed the room was not ready. We were given a free appetizer coupon for the PFC restaurant in the hotel so we could go and wait. I left my cell number with the front desk to call when the room was ready. After over an hour of waiting with no phone call, I sent my S.O. to the front desk to check. After several minutes, he returned visibly angry because the front desk clerk (who was not the one that initially talked to us) had been extremely rude to him because the reservation was not in his name. I finally went to the front desk myself and was checked in by another very sweet girl. It seems strange to me that they would ask for my phone number, and then never call! As per my paid upgrade, we received an 11th floor room with balcony and bay view. It was a wonderful view. But the room was obviously old and in need of updating. Furniture was scratched, I could see pins sticking out of the curtains near the ceiling, the TV remote buttons stuck, and the shower lost water pressure in the middle of a shower. When we left to go out for dinner (it was a surprise birthday dinner for my S.O. so I had privately arranged a taxi with the front desk earlier), the parking attendant recognized and approached us to say that the window on our car had been rolled down and was now stuck half-way down. At this point, we were becoming slightly irate at the continued sub-par treatment we were receiving. After seeing how irritated we were getting, he finally offered to comp us the parking fee. Embassy Suites had pre-arranged a fee for our taxi at $35 to get to Coronado. On our return trip, we discovered the actual meter cost was less than $20. Thanks for the rip-off, Embassy Suites. We could not enjoy the managers reception because 30 people were lined up to get their free drinks, we could not enjoy the complimentary breakfast because the line was wrapped around the corner, and we could not enjoy the pool or jacuzzi because both of them were packed. When we checked out in the morning, the parking fee had not been waived and we had to have a final battle with the front desk about getting the charges removed! Essentially, I paid close to $300 for a nice view. I will definitely never come back to this location. I'll take the stellar service and rooms in La Jolla any day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia9933
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for the first time last May and we loved it. The breakfast had a good selection, you can choose the ingredients for the lovely omelettes they make or have porridge, cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurts, toast with a choice of spreads, Danish-type pastries and more. The Manager's happy hour was very generous and had a nice selection of wines, beers and soft drinks as well as snacks. The staff was very friendly and we found that their advice regarding places to visit and the hiring of a car plus organizing a tour was very efficient. The beds were comfortable and all was very clean. Good, clean bathroom generously repleshined with toiletries and fresh towels daily. It is a big hotel yet we found it quiet and friendly with four fast and bright elevators.The location is excellent, just opposite the attractive Seaport Village where the Chicago deep pan pizza is a must, nicest pizza we ever had, plus the shops are delightful and there was good entertainment during the weekend as well. Also across from the hotel is the Aircraft Carrier Museum USS Midway and it's a walking distance to the Gaslamp Quarter. If you don't have a car, there is an efficient, inexpensive and fun way to get around, it's a light-rail system that has three lines: the Blue line travels between Old Town (a must see), downtown and San Ysidro; the Orange line: Gaslamp Quarter, the Convention Center, Seaport Village and the Green line: Old Town and Santee. Tickets are available at station vending machines and are good for buses too. Coronado and La Jolla are two beautiful places to visit, Old Town State Historic Park and Balboa Park with the art museums and wonder architecture, are just magic. We would go back to the Embassy Suites with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IowaGrandparents
Reviews.Content: We really like Downtown San Diego and try to get there as often as possible on business. On most occasions when traveling as a couple we make the Embassy Suites our base. Again on this trip we were not disappointed. Super convenient to the airport and an easy walk to Petco Field, the Convention Center, the harbor attractions, and gas lamp district restaurants. The trolley (and Amtrak) is close at hand. A short drive reaches Point Loma, Balboa Park, SeaWorld, Old Town, and pretty much any other district you would want to visit within the area. True, it's a typical Embassy Suites with families crowding into rooms and reunions and conferences keeping things hopping. But the manager's reception is wonderful, the breakfast is up to ES standards and there's even a Starbucks on the property. Besides, with the double rooms, you can always insolate yourself from the sounds of the atrium activity. One ding, perhaps is the crowded lobby. Some of the somewhat brusque demeanor that staff can exhibit at times probably comes simply from trying to keep people from tripping over each other -- or themselves. We, however, found everyone truly helpful, including the concierge for dinner reservations, and the valet parking attendants who almost always kept, literally, on the run. One special note. When we left for the airport at 4:45 AM, the valet attendant was nowhere in sight. A custodial staff quickly noted the problem and although speaking very little English made clear to us that he would find the attendant for us and within 90 seconds this janitor had the valet located and on the run to assist us. That kind of thorough going service mind set throughout an organization is what makes the difference between a hotel we want to come back to -- or one that we scratch off our lists. Another compliment. There was new furniture in our room since our last visit. Everything seemed well maintained and furnished. One hint. We think it's worth the extra cost to guarantee a bay view suite. The views are incredible and there is no end to the hours that can be spent just watching ships (including aircraft carriers) and boats (the smallest sailboats) plying the harbor approaches. We even think it's worth the premium to ensure a balcony. Be warned, these aren't lounging style balconies with furniture. But they are wonderful standing verandas that you can step out onto in order to enjoy the sea breeze or just to get a better look at a passing ships. And if nothing else, the sliding door can be left open to bring inside some of the amazing year round comfortable climate of San Diego. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: MLBCLB
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites have never done us worng and Downtown San Diego was no exception. Nice room with beautiful view from balcony of harbor and naval aircraft carriers. Close walk to Gas Lamp District, Seaport Village and USS Midway Museum. Breakfast was good and the desk personnel were very helpful. This was not our first trip to this hotel and certainly won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “What a dreadful and frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: Porter93
Reviews.Content: Such a nice facility. Centrally located. Walking distance from many things. BUT, the service, and the housekeeping were a nightmare. The front desk, promised a ton. Did nothing. My 91 year old mother had an accident at night. We needed fresh sheets. The housekeepers took the ten dollar tip, but did not change the sheets. Left the "please change sheets" sign on bed. After being asked. After being alerted that there was an issue with soiled sheets and the bed got made over the soiled sheets. After the front desk was notified prior to leaving for dinner that the problem was not fixed. At it only got resolved after I blew up and got the night manager up (45 minutes of waiting) there to change the sheets personally. I would suggest that this was an abberaton, but the luggage folks also never got messages, and never did what they promised. But, they did accept the tips. Still, we came down and got all the luggage ourselves, and took it upstairs, and we had to do the same on the way down. I don't know who is running that place, but it needs some heads to roll. We were in the executive suite and it was lovely, but the lack of service flat ruined the experience. Until they get this mess fixed, I would hesitate to recommend the place. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly”
Reviews.Author: ohchad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in two suites early August. We loved the location and size of rooms for our large family. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a huge hit as well. I only wished it had an outdoor pool. Otherwise a really great base for all the san diego sites. We also walked all over the place from our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: thwong
Reviews.Content: We took the bay view executive package which included parking, breakfast and wifi at $254.99 (b4 taxes) a night. The parking service was efficient and hotel front desk staff very helpful. The hot breakfast buffet was great and the egg station really nice. And there was plenty of tables at the breakfast area in the atrium. There were 5 of us in 1 room (2 Adults and 3 children 8,10 and 14) and had a pleasant stay with 2 double beds and 1 double sofa bed and 1 bathroom. I found the coin laundry on site very useful and good value at $1.25 per wash and $1.25 per dry. We had a great view of the bay, coronado bridge and USS midway. We had a car and found the location very good with a few minutes drive to the Westfield mall, restaurants in the nearby Gaslamp quarter, Ralphs to get water, the USS midway, Sea World and San Diego Zoo. As we finished late every nite (ie. after 10pm), there was a Jack in the Box just down the road for late night bites. The hotel was suitable for us as it could accomodate all 5 of us in 1 room as compared to pricier hotels nearby which restricted guests per room to 2 only.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: frisco415
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine except for the fact that they did a lousy job cleaning our room. I called the front desk and said they would send someone but they never did. The next night I ordered some of the overpriced food they offer (dont have the pizza or wings) left the everything outside the door and it was there for hours!! Other than that everything worked out, breakfast is good (a little early)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, convenient to downtown area, breakfast included.”
Reviews.Author: Jsl1962
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good if you have kids--since the rooms are suites the adults can have a little privacy and stay up later. The included breakfast is nice. The added parking cost (nearly $30 a night) seems outrageous, although it's similar to other local hotels. Pool is fine, but was very noisy since it is indoors.

Reviews.Title: “Samurai Sunrise”
Reviews.Author: Ekim A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night during a business training venture. We generally use ES for both business and pleasure. I have stayed at this facility twice before as the location of this facility is ideal to several points of interests for both business and pleasure. On this visit, one of the front desk staff was a bit snotty, I am not sure if it was because I was dressed down or other 'minor' reasons, which is probably the first time I have experienced this type of service at an ES. Not sure why an unhappy uniformed security officer has to stand at the managers reception (kinda reminded me of being in the military). But the rest of the visit and accommodations were up to the standards expected with ES.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel right on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: coloradobkh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August for a trip to Sea World, the USS Midway and Legoland. It took us 10 minutes to get to Sea World. We were so close, we walked to the USS Midway and a Harbor Tour on our 2nd day and it took us 5 minutes to walk down to the Seaport Village. Perfect location! We had a Harbor View room and watched the ships on the bay and were able to see fireworks at night. Great breakfast, but make sure to go early. Great variety of food and an awesome omelet bar. Everyone was very nice and accomodating. We stayed in a double double suite and it was the perfect size for 6 people. Refrigerator and microwave in room. The only negative was there was no beach close by. It is only valet parking, but it was pretty quick service and not a problem for us. Overall a wonderful place to stay and we will stay there again if ever in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdealman
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location. Tough to find street parking but possible. Don't park right across from hotel where homeless village set up. Hotel charges $29 for parking. Big rip off!

Reviews.Title: “The beds were great!”
Reviews.Author: gracieblu80
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my co-workers while we were on our work retreat. We loved that fact that there was a free full breakfast in the morning and a happy hour in the evening that was included with the room rate. The breakfast was good, there was the omelette station, which tends to get really long on Monday mornings, but if you choose to get the other items, it's fine. We enjoyed the complementary drinks at happy hour, there were several choices of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks that were available. The beds were very comfortable, in fact of all the places that I've stayed at this past summer, the ES beds were my favorite! The location is great, it's about a 10 minute walk from the Gaslamp and across the street from Seaport Village. Parking is expensive, they only have valet available and it was $30 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location - Embassy Suites' Reliability”
Reviews.Author: Baboon526
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel was great. Cozy, warm and inviting and the location is definitely what gives it 5 stars over 4. It's your usual Embassy Suites - which we've grown to love and be comfortable with. The lobby was nicely done with a lovely koi pond (please remove the coins from the water, however, they're poisionous for the fish). :) The rooms are fairly large - 2 room suites (as with most of these hotels) and was nicely set up and quite clean. We did have issues with the bathroom - the faucet to the sink was loose and the shower leaked continuosly - but once we mentioned this to the front desk while checking out, the front desk clerk was clearly horrified and I'm sure it was correctly quickly. (though I wonder why the maid never said anything prior to us to the management or front desk). Anyway, the bed and pillows were very comfortable and the room overall was quite nice. Also, we requested a room with a view and got a nice view of the bay. Note: the hotel is located on a fairly busy street so we also had that view - but the bay made us for it. The smell of the free morning breakfasts was a nice wake up call to me (though my husband thought it was a bit much as it wafted into the room each morning). And the breakfasts were consistantly high quality, fresh and delicious. What a wonderful way to start each morning. Also, the atmosphere of eating in the atrium was lovely - and the staff cleaned up and kept everything spotless. The conceirge was very nice and helpful as well and helped us decide to go to Old Town - HIGHLY recommended!!! It was a great day and a wonderful experience. Another plus of the hotel was the little internet room which housed 3 computers. And, the absolute best pro of this hotel was its proximity to Seaport Village! Located about a block away, this village was amazing and my husband and I went every night. There were tons of cute shops and restaurants and it was truly a great place to walk around and great some fresh air and enjoy the sights of the bay and a fireworks show (on Friday night.) Cons of the hotel were minimal and we'd definitely stay here again. Cons include the $29 a night valet parking (but - it's a city and all hotels have this) -- at least these valets were incredibly quick and quite nice too. The other con was the mild smell in the hotel of old dampness. This likely came from the pool downstairs or the fact that the bay is a block away. Again, it is mild and would not turn us off from returning. Thanks again Embassy Suites for a great vacation! PS - on a side note - we also stayed at the Hyatt in Mission Bay (to get a sense of another part of the city as well as try a more upscale hotel.) What a disappointment and we wished we never left the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: IMDOCNC
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. It was just a hop skip away from Sea Port Village. We had a scenic water view from our room. The hotel features were first class including the pool, spa, bar, and fitness room. The room was typical Embassy suite room with a complete separated living which you will not find in a lot of the so call "suite" brands. The breakfast was typical first rate as found in all Embassy Suites. We paid a very fair rate for the room directly through the brand website. I will definitely stay at the hotel when I return to San Diego next year.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Shoppingmcqueen
Reviews.Content: I don't think I could ask for a better location!!! This Embassy Suites is centrally located and within walking distance of a variety of restaurants and retail shops. If you walk 6 blocks in one direction you can get to a great outdoor mall, cross the street and you are at Seaport Village on the San Diego Bay. The airport is maybe 10 minutes away. It is pet friendly and there is a great dog park right around the corner. They have a Starbucks on site, offer free hot breakfast that is comparable to other Embassy Suites I have stayed in and the happy hour is a great treat! The rooms are spacious, clean and up to date. The beds were not the most comfortable I have ever slept in, but definitely not the worst. Be prepared to spend $30/day for parking, wait for valet service (because they are so busy) and not have access to call ahead valet service. They are too busy to take calls. However, they were all very, very nice and I really never had to wait that long. I thought the rates were a little higher than most ES I have stayed in. However, the supreme location and our hotel experience justified the costs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4randdmom
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay here. Our room was upgraded to a 2 room suite which was very spacious. The largest part of the room was the dining/wet bar area. It would have been better for our family to have that area be smaller and have a larger living area. With only one chair, we had to make up the sofa bed each day in order to have seating for all 4 of us. Even if we would have tried to bring in the dining chairs, they would not have fit in the small space where we watched TV. A sink and vanity area is located outside of the bathroom in addition to the one in the bathroom. That was especially nice when my son got sick and we were able to designate his area to try and keep the rest of us well. The hotel was clean and smelled wonderfully fresh as you entered the lobby. It smelled a lot like mildew near one of our sinks, but housekeeping opens the windows each day and that helps. Our room was vacuumed at least one of our 5 days there. I still cannot understand why hotel rooms with 4 occupants only get 2 or 3 washcloths, however! We asked for more and they were quickly provided for. The hotel is located next to Seaport Village which has several shops and restaurants. Most of the restaurants are counter type with outdoor eating space only. So, most of the tables weren't very clean and you have to contend with the pigeons. The setting is gorgeous however with several sidewalk vendors from henna tattoos to balloon twisting. A trolley stop is only a 1/2 block away, but we did not use it. Cindy, the concierge in the hotel lobby, gave us the name of a driver who provided round-trip transportation for us to the zoo one day and Sea World the next. We had 7 in our party and the rate was only $20-$25. The breakfast was delicious with several things to choose from. Even our "no-breakfast eating teenager" was able to find something he liked. The manager's reception was nice as well. Lots of variety at the bar area. The pool and spa area was your typical hotel fare. There were plenty of towels and seating. I was disappointed that it was an indoor pool, but considering the temps are always so mild and pleasant, outdoors would have been too cold! We ate at the hotel restaurant twice and were pleased with the food. The ambiance is certainly lacking, but it was okay. Overall a nice place, but perhaps more suited to the business traveler instead of families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: BreckBearSki
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing the bay - thanks to the other TripAdvisor reviews that warned of the "street noise" - we requested bay view at the time of booking and it was the first thing we asked about - to confirm - when we checked in. Biggest hassle was the mandatory valet parking, but you just deal with it and plan accordingly. Breakfast was HEAVILY attended - so when setting your departure time, be sure to tack on extra time to account for the lines at breakfast and the line to get your valet parked car. Location was great, we walked to a Padres game and it was reasonable. Also walked around the harbor and the Seaside Village across the street. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, but must pay for parking”
Reviews.Author: mojo6170
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful rooms, delicious breakfast--location is great, can walk, take public transportation including the trolly, bus or ferry just about anywhere you want to go. This is a plus, because the hotel charges $20/day for parking. We chose not to rent a car, since the fee for parking just wasn't worth it for us. If you do want to rent a car for a day trip you can easily take the trolly to Little Italy where there are many rental cars available. You can do many sight-seeing trips around San Diego on foot, or public transportation. This was a fun vacation--and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sedona888
Reviews.Content: My teenagers and I love Embassy Suites and this one on the Bay in San Diego was wonderful. Super clean room, nice, friendly staff and excellent free breakfast made our stay even better. We were on the 10th floor and had windows that actually opened. They had had complimentary earplugs that came in handy to block out the streets sounds. The concierge was very helpful and gave us lots of advice on things to do (even some free things) in the city. San Diego is awesome and we will definitely come back to the Embassy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! Elizabeth and Lindsey at the front desk are the best!”
Reviews.Author: SteveinBako
Reviews.Content: Stayed in late July for business and family vacation (Comic Con). We have stayed several times at this hotel. When we arrived late (around 11pm) we were greeted by Elizabeth. She woked with us to make sure our two reservations (one I booked, one booked though SD travel and visitors bureau Comic Con again). Elizabeth gor our rooms worked out. We got the upgrade to the two bedroom suite worked out. She did this all with a smile on her face! Warm greeting by the bellman staff and parking attendante as well. When I neded some small items like info, coins for the laundry machines and when my wife lost her breakfast coupon card, Lindsey was always ready to help. When we left after 6 days, our bellman (forgot his name) was again smiling and helped us load up our many items and got them to the car which the parking staff had waiting for us when we got downstairs. Overall, the best experiece I have ever had. Only one problem. When we checked in the shower head was disconnted in the master bath. We called down the next morning and they have it repaired on the spot! One other concern. I booked the room again for next year. The best rate I could get was $695 for a basic suite. I booked it, but feel a little taken advantage of. But, that has nothing to do with the overall experience. Thanks Elizabeth and Lindsey!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Piaget18
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd Embassy Suites stay in my life. I did not expect anything spectacular and anything bad, just a good reasonable comfortable stay with free breakfast. All of my expectations were met. I was able to check in early (before noon) and was given a balcony room by a nice front desk clerk. Only bad thing about the balcony room is that your next door neigbor also have a balcony and can see directly into your bed so you may have to use the privacy curtain. But I will take a balcony room anyday over the standard room. The room overall was typical of Embassy Suites with comfortable bed, roomy seating area with fridge and microwave. Room was pretty clean except the doors to the balcony were little dirty with a lot of fingerprints. I went down to eat breakfast at 7AM (thanks to still on the Eastern time zone). On the menu: Omelettes, scrambled eggs, home fries, bacon, pancakes, yogurt, apple, banana, pastries, cereals, coffee, milk and juices. The qaulity is okay and more than satisfactory for a "complimentary" breakfast. The dining area staff were always pleasant except the omelette station cooks who are pokerfaced, probably due to the pressure to move the lines quickly. Talking about the lines, between 7 - 8:30AM appears to be the best time. After that, I noticed the lines got really long for both the omelette and the hot food stations. The manager's reception also brought a long line to the bar. I only grabbed popcorn which was good. I didn't see any hot food items like chicken wings. Location was great as a tourist. You are a few blocks away from the trolley lines and the Seaport Village which I enjoyed for food (except for the price of a Hagaan Daaz milk shake, $8!!). I debated staying more towards downtown (Westin) but I much prefer this location as unless you are right on Gaslamp Quarters area, the other downtown locations are pretty dead and don't really have things to do or character based on my observations. Gaslamp area is very busy with a lot of restaurants/bars, if that is your style. I didn't check out the pool so no comment on that. This area seemed safe with some upscale looking residential condos in the area. I would definately stay here again. Things to note: The commuter train noise some of the reviewers are complaining is overrated. Unless you are really sensitive to noise, it won't bother you. I hate to pay for parking. I rented a car the last day of my stay and found a street parking couple of blocks away for overnight. I just had to feed the meeter at 8am (I think it has a 3 hour limit). I didn't really see restaurants around this area except in the Seaport Village which is nearby. Taxi from airport is about $12 - $13. I enjoyed San Diego Zoo, Balboa Park, Coronado beach. Seaworld was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but very nice & great location”
Reviews.Author: Sometimestravler
Reviews.Content: The front desk personnel were efficient. The breakfast (included with the cost of the room) is well above the usual hotel breakfast. The location was great. I could walk to Seaport Village, restaurants, the Midway, along the bay, etc. I selected a room on the bay side on an upper level floor which had a great view and no train noise. (The train tracks are nearby on the opposite side of the hotel.) Downsides: the cost and no airport transportation. If you have a car, the space is very tight for loading & off loading and they charge for the parking. I recommend the hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything I was looking for and expect from an Embassy suites. The room was a good size, clean and the bathroom was updated. The location was great for doing anything downtown. The seaside village, Gaslamp Quarter, and the heart of downtown were all within walking distance. The breakfast buffet food was good although the atmosphere itself could get a bit chaotic. The pool was a good size and the valet service was very quick. Although it was annoying to have valet be my only parking option, I never had to wait more than 5 min for my car. I would stay at this hotel again if I had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfayn
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Embassy Suites. As other travelers have mentioned, the breakfast is great and so was the manager's reception. Our room was a nice size with plenty of room for two adults and three teenagers. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. The valet parking is outrageous, $29 a night. I understand that they must use valet parking due to the lack of space, but I think around $20 a night would have been much easier to swallow. The manager who checked us in flinched when he told us how much it was, I think he had been yelled at for it before. The only other drawback was the fact that they only offer handicap accessible rooms with one king bed, there are none in the hotel with two queens or doubles. I have a disabled 14 year old who was unable to shower the entire four nights we were there. This situation really needs to be remedied. I would love to be able to stay at an Embassy Suites again but we won't if this is the standard situation for this brand.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, included breakfast and 2 hr free happy hour”
Reviews.Author: PRESCOTTAZ
Reviews.Content: Location within walking distance of Convention Center and Gaslamp District. Nice suite with large separate sitting and bedroom with 2 televions. Refrig for snacks and microwave for our use. Be sure to ask the cooks for the cook to order omelets - very good. Only con was the food at the on-site restaurant - awful. One of the worst crab cakes I have ever had. Instead walk across street to the Harbor House restaurant for wonderful seafood and a 2 million dollar view. Will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: JRO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I tend to stay with the Hilton hotel family when not seeking out a B&B, and as such have stayed in several Embassy's. They are usually a good deal in that the accommodations are spacious, the beds are always comfortable, you are offered a full, hot breakfast, and it's nice to relax with a glass of wine or cocktail in the afternoon - and all of this is included in the upfront price. This particular hotel excelled with customer service, the pool/hot tub area, Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, and especially, the location. It's across the street from the waterfront, a block or so from the USS Midway and touring boats, a couple of blocks from the convention center and the Gaslamp district, and a very short drive to Petco/Padres stadium. There are many restaurants right at the front door. The hotel common areas are lovely. The only two negatives that I have is that some of the inroom furniture has seen better days. They may be in the process of replacing it, though, as there appears to be brand new pieces mixed in among the battle weary. The other is that housekeeping is just adequate. One day we were left only one wash cloth, another day there was no bar soap. They kept everything very clean, but the lack of attention here was annoying. It certainly isn't a deal breaker, just some useful info to notice before you settle in for the evening. On a positive note for inroom thoughtfulness - they provide earplugs by the bed in case "city sounds" are something to which you are not unaccustomed. Nice touch -

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NVSallyReno
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from "Seaport Village" for shopping and restaurants. Two blocks away from the Santa Fe Rail Station for Amtrak, Coaster Commuter Rail and a couple other local trains. Nice clean, comfortable appointed two room suite with King Bed. Because the trains run two blocks away there are two sets of ear plugs in the bedroom.
